citation.article-title: Description of two new thermophilic Desulfotomaculum spp., Desulfotomaculum putei sp. nov., from a deep terrestrial subsurface, and Desulfotomaculum luciae sp. nov., from a hot spring.

p.s: Description of Desulfotomaculum luciae sp. nov.
Desulfotomaculum luciae (lu'ci.ae. L. gen. n. luciae of Lucia, referring to the source of the type strain, a hot spring in St. Lucia)
Cells are motile rods that are 1 by 3 Î¼m.
Growth is respiratory with formate, H2, pyruvate, ethanol, or lactate as the electron donor and sulfate or thiosulfate as the electron donor.
Acetate, malate, methanol, and glucose are not catabolized, either alone or in the presence of sulfate, and sulfur and sulfite are not reduced.
Growth occurs on pyruvate or lactate in the absence of an electron acceptor other than CO2, but no growth occurs on fructose or glucose.
The type strain is SLT (= SMCC W644).
